titles.title: Expressing the sense of the Congress that the government of the United States should encourage resumption of direct, bilateral talks between India and Pakistan at the earliest possible time.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on International Relations.

bill.summary: 4/6/1995--Introduced. Calls for the President and the Secretary of State to reiterate to the Prime Minister of Pakistan the urgent need to resume a bilateral dialogue with India. Urges the Governments of Pakistan and India to set an early date for the resumption of such direct bilateral talks.
